intro: Loasa striata, commonly known as the velvetleaf loasa, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and its showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Loasa striata is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
